website_summaries.verdict: These large, colorful, and dense pellets are a high-quality daily diet that provides the chewing material, Omega-3 fatty acids, and fiber rats need for a long and happy life.
pros: Soybean meal, corn, wheat, oats, alfalfa meal, and peanuts are the first 6 ingredients
cons: Fussy rats may prefer some pellet colors over others

customer_reviews.title: Great for gerbils & hamsters, but not rats!
customer_reviews.text: This food is fine for gerbils or hamsters. We use it for my daughter's gerbils. For rats DO NOT USE! The reason is they used processed corn which blocks rats intestines. Some rats may not show signs but avoid it overall. The best food for rats is Oxbow adult or young rat food. Rats love it, but warning it is expensive. You can find it cheaper on Amazon than in pet stores.
customer_reviews.author: kldice

customer_reviews.title: Kaytee is a decent pellet for the short term, ...
customer_reviews.text: Kaytee is a decent pellet for the short term, but it certainly isn't the healthiest thing you could be feeding your rats, especially as their main source of food. I adopted a little rat and fed him almost exclusively Kaytee pellets (aside from treats) and I believe he would have lived longer and been healthier had I known about Oxbow sooner. I would encourage heavy supplementing with fruits, veggies, and proteins or just going with Oxbow Adult rat formula. It's a little more expensive, but if you buy in bulk here on Amazon the price is very comparable.
customer_reviews.author: Z Boss

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure this almost killed my rat. And apparently mines not the first. Idk why they make stuff like this. It’s first ingredient is corn which is bad for rats. I didn’t know that when I bought it. Just save yourself the worry and spend a little more and get oxbow rat food.
customer_reviews.author: aimee presnell

customer_reviews.title: Decent for what it is
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the best all around food but I mix it in with the mouse and the rat blends for different forage. They both really love the dental bits that we call 'cookies' (the guinea pigs won't eat anything but their version!). However it's not the most sought after food in the bowl. The mice tend to eat it more than the rats, but I offer it as a chewable option for tooth health and something else to do. I would not recommend it as a sole source of nutrition unless your animal has always been brought up on lab block only. Once they get a forage mix they'll never go back lol.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Postle

customer_reviews.title: Its Rat food...
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this for my daughters rats. They ate it but did not really like it as they would nibble on it and leave the vast majority of it in the dish or on the floor of the cage. IDK what those lil blue/green things are but they hated those. They would pluck them out and toss them outta the cage. It was fun watching them dig through and find those lil blue/green things. I did keep them busy and active for a bit. (BTW my dog that eats EVERYTHING...n I mean everything would not eat those lil blue/green things)
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Rockefeller

customer_reviews.title: insufficient nutrition!
customer_reviews.text: kaytee is known to contain harmful preservatives. other than that fact im not sure about other "small animals" but this food is not suitable for mice or rats as they should be getting 12-14% protein (as adults anyway), not 20% because it can cause some serious health problems (as it has with my mice). even if you mix this with lower protein foods or use this on breeding mice/rats its still not suitable as some of the first main ingredients are corn and alfalfa and you would do better by supplementing their regular diet with a high quality dog food istead. i also know some people have had issues with soy and wheat by-products.
customer_reviews.author: ppilppil

customer_reviews.title: I think it killed our hamster
customer_reviews.text: We had a little over a year old hamster that went down hill after the switch to this food. We switched because we thought it was better for her but now I'm thinking it wasn't. I suggest if you use this food that you only drop in a couple pellets with seeds, and fresh fruits and veggies (in moderation of course).
customer_reviews.author: someguy

customer_reviews.title: My Rats Won't Eat It
customer_reviews.text: I bought this food for my rats because it would provide more bang for the buck. However, my rats really didn't like this food at all. I had to supplement constantly because one of my rats straight out went hungry before touching this food. I've switched them back to the Oxbow Regal Rat Food now, which they love but is more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is the best value rat pellets for the price, it is not worth it. No matter if they're bought in-store or online about a half pound of it arrives crushed into dust. The blue/green pellets give my rats brightly colored and very soft poop, plus they hate eating the green stuff! So in reality after subtracting the dust and the green pellets, you're really only getting maybe 3 pounds worth of useable food. Considering how it affects my rat's bowel movements, I don't think it's safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Cady

customer_reviews.title: My rats absolutely love this food!
customer_reviews.text: One of the better commercially/commonly available rat foods on the market. We breed rats and have nothing but good things to say about Forti-diet. There ARE more natural/holistic foods available on the market from small shops and co-ops, but this is the most easily found and the best value for your money on that basis. The small bits are particularly popular with younger rats. Even the pellets are easily digestible.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia H.

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE PRICE.
customer_reviews.text: Pros are the mice like it. The cons are I’m paying for a lot for pellet dust. The bottom of the bag was layered with pellets that have deteriorated into dust. Over one cup of dust. I don’t know if it’s because these bags are left overs or poor shipping. Whatever the reason, it’s not worth purchasing when I’m not receiving the pellet amount that is actually edible. A little pellet dust is normal, not almost two cups worth.
customer_reviews.author: Dalia2018

customer_reviews.title: The best rat food I have found so far
customer_reviews.text: Overall the best pre-made food I have found for my rats although it makes a mess and my rats poop is blue-green. The rats leave the blue and green pellets for last because its obviously not their favorite. I suppose this is better than some other options because this is pellets and not seed shells everywhere, but the pellet dust gets everywhere too.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: More disappointing than a family size bag of Lays
customer_reviews.text: The bag had a solid pound and a half of dust. I can't speak to the taste or freshness because I didn't eat it. The rats ate it, but they eat a lot of questionable things so it's at least edible. As to the freshness, stuff could have been fresh from the extruder, it's cereal paste and dye, and again, the rats aren't picky. I was just not thrilled to dispose of 20% of the bag in inedible dust.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Carter

customer_reviews.title: Rats don't like it and it's not the healthiest food anyway
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a while for my rats when I was a new rat owner and didn't really know any better. I ended up adopting some new rats and the shelter recommended I switch to Mazuri because this stuff is kinda junk. It is like the meow mix equivalent of rat food. Surprisingly my rats actually like the Mazuri more, so it was a win-win.
customer_reviews.author: C. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but the price is high.
customer_reviews.text: My rat farm eats this stuff up quickly! But you can get better prices from other brands buying bulk from a feed store or online. I buy this when I need something delivered fast because I have forgotten to replenish my food stock. It smells fresh and healthy for the rats.
customer_reviews.author: Camilla Dennison

customer_reviews.title: This is a great pet rat food
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pet rat food. I love the resealable bag. I also love that it comes in a larger size bag than what I can find locally. I was also very impressed to find that this has a higher protein and nutritional content than any of the lab blocks I was able to find locally. My rats love this part of their food probably more than any of the other things it gets mixed with, though probably slightly less then the occasional piece of shrimp, chicken, or beef they get as a treat from our plates. I will definitely order this product again and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan M

customer_reviews.title: Rats Like It, Me Not So Much.
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars on all sub-categories, however only giving 4 overall because I wish the little pieces weren't colored and just grain colored as the larger pieces. If they toss a piece out and it gets wet, I have a food coloring mess to clean up. Also a LOT of dust at the bottom of the bag, so much that I wasn't able to use to last scoop or so of food. Some is expected, but it was almost like some of the food itself was ground up.
customer_reviews.author: Jess B.

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I got this food for my rats. I'm a first time rat momma and am learning as I go. I do know that rats are very susceptible to tumors so I'm trying g to be as careful as possible with them. This is the second food they've tried and so far, so good. They REALLY seem to love the blue and green chunks. It does say to feed 2 tablespoons per rat a day, but they also get fresh fruit and veggies so this will last a WHILE. I'm also glad I read the bag because it says for extended use (over 45 days), to keep frozen or refrigerated. I will do that. Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jetta

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Our rat did eventually eat some of the things in the mix only ate it when nothing else was provided. More of the food was wasted than was actually eaten. There is so much seed that this would be better as bird food. Some of it was so tiny that I believe it was put in there to make the weight of the product look better.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: I like, rat likes
customer_reviews.text: Looks like my ratty would have but she doesn't and it's non meat by product sources help with odor control. Rat in excellent health, healthy weight, happy and smells ok, what else do you want in rodent food?
customer_reviews.author: Jason M, MT(AAB)

customer_reviews.title: It's food alright!
customer_reviews.text: My rats seem to like it well enough. Not as well as mixed bags of seed and whatnot, but if I give them that they just pick out their favorite parts and leave the rest :) This way they can't be picky and wasteful! They're hardy little guys and I don't notice a difference in their behavior or coat texture/shine if I feed them this or another kind of food, so either this stuff is average at best or rats just aren't bothered by dietary changes.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry McFarland

customer_reviews.title: but the little guys like to bury the food
customer_reviews.text: We used to buy this trailmix type stuff for the rats that had all manner of different types of foods in it, but the little guys like to bury the food, so it was hard to tell when they were out unless you watched them closely. The larger pellets in here are very visible, and while they aren't quite as excited eating these, they definitely chow down and I love the cost to amount ratio. Good stuff, give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Megan W.

customer_reviews.title: Good Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice price for the quantity. My rat was about 4 years old when I bought this and was at the end of her life so it's hard to say whether or not she liked it as she didn't live long enough to eat much of it. I wouldn't say it's fresh as it's all dried and processed. As far as the flavor goes, I didn't eat it so I can't help anyone there.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hamsters love it they live a long time on it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality food for our hamsters. They love it they eat it and they stash it all over the place. Most of our hamsters live to to even 3 years. And does nothing more that you can say than that.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: FortiDiet for Ratties
customer_reviews.text: Great buy on food pellets for my ratties. They enjoy munching on these and they will last quite a while. No issues with pests inside the bag, no mold, everything is good. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: notasushifan

customer_reviews.title: A good base for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: While I tend not to use that much of the Forti in my hamsters weekly mix, (I prefer to use it as the 'carbs' of the mix while subbing in my own veg/protein), it does the job in a pinch! The mix is good for the price, and my hamster doesn't mind it compared to any fancier version I've used. I wouldn't reccommend giving this alone to your small friend, but nothing to scoff at to be assured.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR MICE
customer_reviews.text: There is NO WAY my mice can eat these pellets. They are hard and too big to eat. I have to pound them into smaller pieces for the mice to be able to eat them. Pain in the .....
customer_reviews.author: A. Lieberman

customer_reviews.title: Rats wouldn't even eat anything if it was in the bowl. BUT the customer service was amazing. Kaytee always has good service.
customer_reviews.text: My rat hated it. Wouldn't even eat if it was in a mix of their food. First ingredient is soy. Make sure you're checking the ingredients if you're buying for rats. I know my boys wont even touch alfalfa so a high alfalfa mix product is bad for them. The customer service was excellent, and they always have been. Thats the only reason I continue to try kaytee.
customer_reviews.author: Alle Gannon

customer_reviews.title: My rats wouldn’t touch it
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure it’s not the brands fault, but just a heads up, my rat toes wouldn’t touch this stuff with a ten foot pole. They will eat basically anything else 😂. Not sure why, but maybe try a different brand first ;)
customer_reviews.author: Elise bee

customer_reviews.title: Our hamsters love them.
customer_reviews.text: Our hamsters will not eat any other pellets. We have had hamsters for years and all have enjoyed these. Dwarf hamsters and teddy bears too! And all have had nice long life spans with this food as part of their diet. We tried the so called healthier pellets that cost twice as much. They literally took them andnput them in their potty. Yeah. We switched back to these and happy hamsters once again.
customer_reviews.author: TsunamiMommyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great food for dwarf hamsters. One bag lasts forever.
customer_reviews.text: My dwarf hamsters love this food. Despite their size, they manage to move the morsels throughout their homes. I supplement it with small amounts of hamster food with seeds. My four little ladies have lived 2 years on this diet.
customer_reviews.author: H.C.

customer_reviews.title: MICE WONT EAT
customer_reviews.text: My mice will not eat this! Mice literally eat everything, but they won’t eat this!.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Thomas

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: my rat seems to like these more than other food I've tried and easier to feed them by handing him a few throughout the day rather than filling a bowl every day
customer_reviews.author: Skylar Lybrand

customer_reviews.title: Mouse didn't like it, but wild squirrels and raccoon did
customer_reviews.text: My mouse won't eat it, I think the pieces are too big. I also don't like some of the ingredients in it. I've been feeding it to the wild squirrels and a raccoon that comes into the yard sometimes. They seem to love it, there's never any left when I put it out.
customer_reviews.author: Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Totally recomend
customer_reviews.text: My Syrian hamster loves these! They are pretty big so you only need to use like 2-3 a day and they are an AMAZING price!
customer_reviews.author: vanessa meacham

customer_reviews.title: Won’t eat it
customer_reviews.text: My 4 rats won’t touch it... so, I threw it out to the chickens. The chickens won’t touch it, either, and they eat everything! I’ve had better luck with Kaytee Fiesta rat food.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: There are better choices for your rats
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was fast. When I opened the bag of kaytee small animal food, it smelled old. My rats are not too pickey but they would not eat those little green things in the bag (that’s really bad if my rats won’t eat it and rats eat their own Poop). When the bag got to 3/4 gone the rest in the bag (1/4) was crumbled up and unusable. However The green things were intact (what are those). I won’t buy this again (not even in the store). I don’t recommend this product for any animals (not even if they are feeders (in my humble opinion)).
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Meh, mediocre
customer_reviews.text: My ratties didn't care for most of the food in this bag so it ended up being a waste of money for me. Back to Oxbow.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Cook

customer_reviews.title: Rats won’t even touch it!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap food and my rats won’t eat it, but my rats are used to quality food which this is not. It’s not Kaytee’s fault, it’s mine for trying to find a cheap emergency option as their favorite food is out of stock.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping. Rats love it
customer_reviews.text: Item shipped fast for my rats. It's been difficult to find rat food and this was a relief and totally worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Kshawmeister

customer_reviews.title: Solid basic staple pellet -- be sure to include other things in your rattie's diets, though
customer_reviews.text: Basic staple food for my ratties, works well. They like it and eat it, but definitely prefer fresh veggies/etc. They aren't super-crazy about the colored bits, but love the pellets. Oxbow is the best nutrition-wise, but when it shot up in price suddenly and the local pet store stopped carrying it, I switched to this.
customer_reviews.author: SilvieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great food great price
customer_reviews.text: Our girls(Rats) like this food and a great value for the price. Karen and Ophelia like the green treats in the bag
customer_reviews.author: Robin C.

customer_reviews.title: Our Hamster will eat this brand
customer_reviews.text: Our hamster liked this brand and ate most of the blend. She can be pretty picky...
customer_reviews.author: Christine W

customer_reviews.title: Nice Affordable Food.
customer_reviews.text: I put some of this in with my mice's seed mix and they seem to really like it. They're particularly fond of the smaller green blocks that are mixed in, but they also munch on the larger ones. They seem to be doing fairly well on this food too, so that's always a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: They like it, and they seem to be very healthy
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a well balanced food for my gerbils, with the occasional addition of seed/vegetable treats. They like it, and they seem to be very healthy. I've had them for two years, and they're still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: WolfSinger

customer_reviews.title: Great Diet for Hamster
customer_reviews.text: Larger than I expected so well worth the price! I have been trying to find a hamster food that didn't consist of only treats and I finally found one! My little one likes to move it around her habitat and just put it into a corner most of the time instead of just eating it in her bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Anne Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Bug Infestation
customer_reviews.text: My hamster likes this food but recently found bugs in the bag! Gross and gross. There was dust at the bottom of the bag like another reviewer described. Most likely from the bugs nibbling on the pellets. I've been buying this brand for years and this is my first bug infestation. Will need to keep an eye on the food and put it in a clear container.
customer_reviews.author: LilyBook

customer_reviews.title: Rats like it
customer_reviews.text: My 2 rattie boys, Finn and Fry, like this well enough. Not their number one fave, but it is a solid choice for their dietary needs.
customer_reviews.author: P. L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Healthy
customer_reviews.text: The rats don't prefer it but they can't have have treats all the time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cavalla

customer_reviews.title: rat addiction
customer_reviews.text: Another would have my rats favorite food. I will buy again and it's a great value
customer_reviews.author: Fordy241977

customer_reviews.title: The Good Kush
customer_reviews.text: GREAT deal in terms of weight/price!! I usually see 3lb for $10+ in pet stores. kids (6 rats, 2 adult and 2 young) love it. full diet without the choice for them to be picky. still, make sure to add fresh veggies/fruits to their diet for extra nutrition as treats ;)
customer_reviews.author: Kris K.

customer_reviews.title: Rat food
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 rats like the little green chunks but the blocks don’t seem to be going anywhere so I got some of my usual feed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent hamster food
customer_reviews.text: My hamsters favorite, though I mix it with another brand. I just wish those blue and green pieces weren't in it now. I've never had a hamster who liked them.
customer_reviews.author: Jennsen

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product looks like it has been smashed, lots of dust, powered pellets etc in the bag
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad food
customer_reviews.text: Horrible I found out for rats and this food can cause death in’s rats and mice
customer_reviews.author: Larry V.

customer_reviews.title: Bad food/turns to dust
customer_reviews.text: Yes you get a lot for your money. However that really doesn't do any good if the food crumbles to dust before your rodents can eat it and while they are eating it. I would never but this again. Not worth it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissi

customer_reviews.title: My picky eaters actually eat this
customer_reviews.text: My rats are kind of picky eaters. They are eating this food, though. They refused to eat the pellets that were part of the previous food we were feeding them, but they do not refuse this food.
customer_reviews.author: The Tatting Flutist

customer_reviews.title: Our rats wouldn't eat it.
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 male rats. They did not like this food. They didn't eat it at all. I switched back to the food they like (more expensive) - Oxbow adult rat food.
customer_reviews.author: Zac and Joy Haley

customer_reviews.title: Great for rats!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mix! The probiotics option is awesome, and the green bits give my rats green turds, which is hilarious, lol. They're good sized blocks and my rats didn't turn their noses up to it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Not appetizing for humans but delicious to rats
customer_reviews.text: I think these pellets look pretty appetizing, but this is my pets’ favorite brand. Who am I to argue
customer_reviews.author: Coll

customer_reviews.title: Decent, healthy food in a slightly annoying package
customer_reviews.text: Though the package is hard to open and usually the resealable feature is shot (partially because it's poorly designed and partially because it often is right where you're supposed to cut), my rats eat this and there is no filler left behind.
customer_reviews.author: Hayli May

customer_reviews.title: My go-to mouse food
customer_reviews.text: I like that this product has probiotics. My mice do well on it and really like it. They even choose this over treats some days.
customer_reviews.author: Sara B.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I order this 2 months ago and it's still not all gone. Better that getting that tiny bag at Petsmart.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Larger than expected!! But great to mix in with hamster seed food!!
customer_reviews.author: J Pitts

customer_reviews.title: My rats love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My rats love this stuff. Especially the green bits. Sadly I had to start taking them out though because it was all they would eat and they started getting diarrhea. Other wise great food and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Our hamster likes it but not much variety. I'm not sure if variety matters too much though, when we do buy one of those mixes our hamster usually picks out the few she likes anyways. I think these large pellets contain all they need to be healthy.
customer_reviews.author: F. Mok

customer_reviews.title: Rats Love It!
customer_reviews.text: My female rats love it! I only have two and the bag lasts for almost 3 months. The only setback is that soy is one of the first ingredients but that isn't as bad as corn. I am going to buy another bag soon! And my rats are free fed, so don't thing I am starving them to death, 5 pounds is just alot of food if you are also giving them a quarter of a cup of fruits and veggies! Over all good long lasting food!
customer_reviews.author: Torey

customer_reviews.title: Our rat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Have fed this to our rat for her entire life. She is now three years old and loves this food... especially the little green pieces!
customer_reviews.author: Kat Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Our young rat loves this food! She eats the green pieces first but then finishes off the big chunks. Food seems fresh and she looks super healthy! Great value! I'll buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Kerrie Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Millie the hairless rat
customer_reviews.text: Rescued a hairless rat that owners planned to use as bait for dog fight. Took two days before Millie would try to eat, so ordered this food and she is starting to come around
customer_reviews.author: Kansas Gal

customer_reviews.title: Continuous purchase
customer_reviews.text: Excellent addition to my mixture of food that I have created.
customer_reviews.author: wendellsue66

customer_reviews.title: not as balanced as the picture
customer_reviews.text: was expecting an equal amount of the green but the bag was filled almost conpletelynwith the brown pellets
customer_reviews.author: janelle

customer_reviews.title: My rats hate this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My rats hate this stuff! I usually buy Oxbow, but Amazon decided to take away its Prime deal on it, and before that make it an add-on item. I decided to try this stuff in the meantime. One pro is, there's a lot of it. But my rats hate it. Aside from that, the blue bits in it are concerning. When they do break down and eat it, they usually eat the blue first. And there's tons of the small noodle shaped blue treats in the bag. It turns their stool a bright blue, the same colour as the threats. It's very concerning, and I will not be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: but they hate them. They rarely eat them and usually throw ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my rats so they could eat healthy, but they hate them. They rarely eat them and usually throw them out of their food bowl. I tried transitioning them from their old food, but they only would eat their old food and throw out this one. Guessing it doesn't taste all that good to them.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy with zero waste.
customer_reviews.text: I breed mice and these are a must. It is not the only food I feed them but it makes up about 50% of their diet. Very affordable too because there is zero waste.
customer_reviews.author: Margana S

customer_reviews.title: Worked, but do research
customer_reviews.text: It came, and the rats loved it. I did read online it actually is not good for them, but I am not sure so do your research.
customer_reviews.author: Gremmy

customer_reviews.title: Best price, best value!
customer_reviews.text: absolutely the best food for the price! My rat, Pebbles loves this!
customer_reviews.author: Sdubs

customer_reviews.title: I think it's a really good deal when comparing prices to Petco
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a really good deal when comparing prices to Petco. The bag comes with the food pellets and also some blue and green slim pellets that I think might be for their teeth health, but I'm not sure. My hamster enjoys eating both types.
customer_reviews.author: P.D. Choi

customer_reviews.title: More for my money and they love it!
customer_reviews.text: This product was used to feed my daughter's pet rats: Tyrone, Bandit, and Ratatouille. They love the taste and it it fills them up quicker than other rat food. It is a better bargain because i get more for the money i spend on it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Williams

customer_reviews.title: It’s good
customer_reviews.text: Its healthy for my hamster he enjoys them the bag was bigger then I thought it would be I have a tiny hamster and this is probably gonna last in his life 💀otherwise good
customer_reviews.author: j.xdf

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this! Killed my hampster
customer_reviews.text: My hampster died after eating this .. 2 weeks after eating this .. not a good source off food at all!
customer_reviews.author: Am

customer_reviews.title: seems to be not just for for rats and mice but drugs can not get enough of it.
customer_reviews.text: seems to be not just for for rats and mice but drugs can not get enough of it. my rats loooooovvvvesss it, i wish it is cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: babygottaluvme

customer_reviews.title: Mice Stopped Breeding with this food
customer_reviews.text: I fed my mice ENVIGO and they bred right away. Shortly after, I switched to this and they stopped breeding for a month. Switched them back, and bam, breeding again. I was not satisfied at all, and can only use this food in my overflow cage.

customer_reviews.title: What's with the new sticks?
customer_reviews.text: I used to purchase the formula of this product that just contained the lab blocks themselves. My rats pick out the dental stick things. Other than that, this product is fine and a fair price! :-)

customer_reviews.title: Hamsters love the taste of this brand and great nutrition
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for several years for Syrian Hamsters, Roborovski Hamsters and Winter-white Hamsters. Sice it does contain corn and molasses which are sugary, care should be taken when using it for Campbells's Russian Hamsters as they are prone to diabetes. All my hamsters prefer the taste to this brand over other brand blocks such as "Mazuri". This also seems to have better ingredients. I also supplement with higher fiber foods including "Oxbow's Hamster Essentials", fresh dandelion leaves and flowers, and broccoli. I trust the nutrition though and the protein level is correct if breeding your hamster.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Martin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as a very basic, cheap muesli base. consider it a step above 'rattie mcdonald's' food in quality.

customer_reviews.title: my rats love this! I moved them from a food with ...
customer_reviews.text: Hey, my rats love this! I moved them from a food with lots of seeds to this and they took it without any problems! If they love it, I can't ask for more!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Torell

customer_reviews.title: this is great for gerbils
customer_reviews.text: this is great for gerbils, Syrian hamsters, and DJ hamsters if you pick out the green bits in the mix, which does not take long.

product_meta.title: Kaytee FortiDiet ProHealth Rat/Mouse Food, 5 lbs.
product_meta.description:
Size:5 lbs.Kaytee Forti-Diet Pro Health Mouse and Rat food was developed by an animal nutritional expert to ensure you pet gets the proper nutrition. Forti Diet Pro Health contains probiotics and prebiotics to support digestive health. This food is rich in natural antioxidants for general health and immune support plus contains some larger, more crunchy pieces to support dental health through natural chewing activity.
Kaytee understands that sharing your life with a small pet is not only enjoyable but very enriching. Kaytee shows our love by ensuring we provide your small pet with the best nutrition for a long and healthy life. With over 150 years of nutritional experience, it's no wonder why Kaytee is at the heart of every healthy feeding routine.
feature_bullets: Larger, crunchy pieces supports dental health through natural chewing activity
Prebiotics and probiotics to support digestive health

specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
